headline.main: SPY TRIAL HEARS ADVENTURE STORY; South African, Described as Veteran Espionage Agent, Tells of His Career BUT DENIES ALL CHARGES Duquesne Says He Instructed Theodore Roosevet in Big-Game Hunting

lead_paragraph: Frederick Joubert Duquesne, a dark, beetle-browed native of South Africa, whom the government has described as a veteran espionage agent of more than forty years and an inveterate Anglophobe, took the witness stand yesterday in his own behalf at the Brooklyn espionage trial and outlined in dramatic detail a career of adventure, intrigue and mystery.
abstract: F J Duquesne outlines own biography; denies all charges, Bklyn trial
